title: FTSE LIVE: All Thomas Cook shops rescued by Hays; GVC's profits rise
text:
The FTSE 100 closed up 23.35 points at 7166.50 and the pound was at $1.22 against the dollar.

Ladbrokes and Coral owner GVC Holdings is holding firm on plans to close 900 bookies over the next two years, despite saying today that its annual profits will be higher than previously forecast.

Its earnings were boosted by the rapid growth of online gambling and a better-than-expected performance on the High Street.

Meanwhile, car dealership Vertu Motors has revealed falling half-year profits as sales of new cars tumbled more than 10 per cent.

And Hays Travel has said it will buy all 555 of Thomas Cook's shops out of liquidation in a move that saves up to 2,500 jobs.
